derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, 'distance between the tips of the thumb and little finger', of Germanic origin; reinforced in Middle English by Old French espan
mid 16th cent. (as a verb): from Dutch or Low German spannen. The noun (originally in nautical use) dates from the mid 18th cent

entry.def: A span is the period of time between two dates or events during which something exists, functions, or happens.

example.ex: The batteries had a life span of six hours...
example.tran: 这些电池的寿命为 6 小时。

example.ex: Gradually the time span between sessions will increase.
example.tran: 会议之间的间隔将逐渐延长。

entry.def: Your concentration span or your attention span is the length of time you are able to concentrate on something or be interested in it.

example.ex: His ability to absorb information was astonishing, but his concentration span was short...
example.tran: 他吸收信息的能力令人吃惊，但是他的注意力持续时间很短。

example.ex: Young children have a limited attention span and can't concentrate on one activity for very long.
example.tran: 小孩子的注意力持续时间十分有限，不能长时间地专注于一个活动。

entry.def: If something spans a long period of time, it lasts throughout that period of time or relates to that whole period of time.

example.tran: 他的职业生涯持续了 16 年。

example.ex: The film, spanning almost a quarter-century, tells the story of Henry Hill...
example.tran: 这部时间跨度将近四分之一世纪的影片讲述的是亨利·希尔的故事。

entry.def: If something spans a range of things, all those things are included in it.

example.ex: Bernstein's compositions spanned all aspects of music, from symphonies to musicals.
example.tran: 伯恩斯坦创作的乐曲涉及了从交响乐到音乐剧等音乐的各个方面。

example.ex: ...a remarkable man whose interests spanned almost every aspect of nature.
example.tran: 一个兴趣广泛、几乎涉猎了自然学科所有领域的杰出男性

entry.def: The span of something that extends or is spread out sideways is the total width of it from one end to the other.

example.ex: It is a very pretty butterfly, with a 2 inch wing span...
example.tran: 这是一只非常美丽的蝴蝶，翼展 2 英寸。

example.ex: It may be that you are unaware of where your hip joint is; it is not at the waist but a good hand span below it.
example.tran: 这也许是因为你并不晓得髋关节的位置，它不在腰部，而是位于腰部以下一手拃宽处。

entry.def: A bridge or other structure that spans something such as a river or a valley stretches right across it.

example.ex: Travellers get from one side to the other by walking across a footbridge that spans a little stream.
example.tran: 游客通过一座横跨小溪的步行桥从一边来到另一边。

example.ex: ...the humped iron bridge spanning the railway...

sentences.sentence: "the job was finished in the span of an hour"

means.word_mean: 2. the distance or interval between two points
3. two items of the same kind
4. a unit of length based on the width of the expanded human hand (usually taken as 9 inches)
5. a structure that allows people or vehicles to cross an obstacle such as a river or canal or railway etc.
6. the act of sitting or standing astride
1. to cover or extend over an area or time period;

sentences.sentence: "Rivers traverse the valley floor", "The parking lot spans 3 acres"

auth_sentence.content: Most of the band's life span was postlapsarian.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of the band's life span was postlapsarian.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of the band's life span was postlapsarian.

auth_sentence.res_content: A brand new spick-and-span school which had recently opened.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A brand new spick-and-span school which had recently opened.

auth_sentence.content: Driving a cab tends to shorten your life span.
auth_sentence.res_content: Driving a cab tends to shorten your life span.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Driving a cab tends to shorten your life span.

Sentence.sentence: Getting a divorce means risking a reduced life span.

means.word_mean: 跨度, 跨径，（桥或拱的）墩距

sentences.en: The bridge has a span of 100 metres.
The pupil's attention span was short.
sentences.cn: 这个小学生的注意力持续时间很短。

sentences.en: His research in cancer that spanned 15 years has made considerable headway in the end.
sentences.cn: 他对癌症持续15年的研究终于取得了极大的进展。

jushi.english: The bridge has a span of 100 meters.
We should cherish our span of life.
jushi.chinese: 我们应当珍惜我们的人生。

jushi.english: The pupil's attention span was short.
jushi.chinese: 这个小学生的注意力持续时间很短。
